dunc e: verb; noun dunhmei (pluck): chah dunc e (pluck tea)

duplou e: verb; noun duploumei (take shelter): Aniw kai akhat khou duplou e. (We took shelter in a house.)
dut e: adverb; noun dutmei (everything; nothing left): Ai kaguayna thay dut the. (I know everything.); meic guayna guang dut de (everybody came)

dwang e: verb; noun dwangmei (cut down): nngouh dwang e (cut down forest)

dwm e: verb; noun dwmmei (add more on top of full with cover): puatc dwm e (add more on top of full with cover)
dwng: noun (seat): dwng khou dungc o (sit on the seat)

ga e: verb; noun gamei (sliding cut): nngeic ga e (cut the grass); baeng ga e (cut with dao)
gaan e: verb; noun gaanmei (buy food or drink): nap gaan e (buy rice); zouh gaan e (buy wine)

gaanv: noun 1. (husband): nang gaanv (your husband) 2 (person): gaanv khat (one person)

gaek e: verb; noun gaekmei (protect; guard): rihmei nunc rui gaek e (protected by soldiers)

gah: noun 1. (dice): talicpui gac (gaming dice) 2. (ginger like root): chagaimei gac

gang e: adjective; noun gangmei 1. (stiff): kaguang gang e (his neck stiff) 2. (firm): ding gang e (stand firm)
gangc e: verb; noun ganghmei (prevent): Kapui rui kata mih mak khang gangc e. (Her mother prevent her from marriage.)

gap e: verb; noun gapmei (search in an area): kailuangmei gap e (people of the village search the area)

gay e: adjective; noun gaymei 1. (good): Mi hei gay e. (This is good.) 2. (well): Ai gay bam e. (I am well.) verb 1. (throttle): kakhac gay e (he is throttled) 2. (kill): nruay gay e (kill a chicken) 3. (bless): nahzwm gay e (bless baby)

ge: noun (business): 1. Hei khou nang khang tabui ge nai na? (What business do you have here?) 2. (need): Ai Delhi tat nipui ge nai e. (I need to go to Delhi.)

gic e: verb; noun gihmei (tie in row; usually for roofing): kairei gic e (tie roof batten)

hy e: verb; noun hymei (write): Ai tatdyn hy e. (I write a letter.)

hyang: noun 1. (leg): teibal hyang (table leg) 2. (height): Kahyang kauh e. (He is tall.)

kabin e: verb; noun kabinmei (pressed between): ntauh kak khou kabin e (press between stones)
kabing e: adjective; noun kabingmei (weighty): Mi hei how kabing e. (This one is looked weighty/ strong)

kabum e: verb; noun kabummei (beat): zanhkang kabum e (beat dried meat)

takaanc: noun (farewell feast for the dead): apouc takaanc (my grandfather’s farewell feast); takaanc guaic (farewell mithun)
takav: noun (meal pack; meal out of the house)
takh: noun (wisdom): katakh nai e (he has wisdom)
takhaan e: adverb; noun takhaanmei (clear; distinct): how takhaan e (clearly visible); meic thay takhaan e (openly know)
takianh e: verb; noun takianhmei (craving for certain substances in pregnancy; pregnant-sick; pica in pregnancy): kamei takianh bam e (she is in pregnant-sick)
talaemc: noun (a soft small tree with large leaf)
taleh e: adjective; noun talehmei 1. (stylish): Kamei taleh e. (She/he is stylish.) 2. (coquettish): Kamei taleh e. (She/he is coquettish) (This term in Ruangmei is used for both woman and man).
talian e: verb; noun talianmei (disobey): Kamei kapu lat talian e. (He disobeys his father.); Kamei meic talian e. (He defies people.)
talic e: verb; noun talicmei (play): Alauc nunc talic e. (Children play.)
tamcha: noun (prepared chutney): tamcha kuak (a dish with chutney)
tam e: verb; noun tammei (test): Kamei thay the ny tam o. (Test him if he knows.); Lat tam e. (Ask question.)
tamaeng e: verb; noun tamaengmei (sleep talk): Kamei zingbangc tamaeng e. (He talked in sleep last night.)
tamai: noun (gun) tamaipu noun (gun powder) tamaithw noun (bullet)
taman e: adjective; noun tamanmei (tight; close): kakak taman e (the gap is tight)
tamangv e: adjective; noun tamangvmei 1. (dim): mai riw tamangv e (the fire light is dim) 2. (blur; fuzzy): kamaengc tamangv e (the image is blur) 3. (blank): kachwn tamangv e (his mind is blank)
tamc e: verb; noun tamhmei 1. (aim at): Kachung khou tamc e. (Aim at the centre) 2. (target): gay liangmei ta tamc e (target for the best)
tamin e: adjective; noun taminmei (closely tight): alamvmei mun tamin e (the join is closely tight)
taminh e: adjective; noun taminhmei (not fully cooked): nap taminh e (the rice is not properly cook)
tamkhiangh e: adjective; noun tamkhianghmei (active; vigorous; energetic): Kamei tamkhiangh e. (He is active); tamkhianghmei nggaanv nunc (active young people)
tamlinghna: noun (lizard) tammic noun (chutney pestle) tampiwkui noun (toad)
tamthou e: verb; noun tamthoumei (hat): Kaney khat khat ta tamthou e. (They hat each other.)
tamthuang e: verb; noun tamthuangmei (meet unexpectedly): Kaney sow tamthuang e. (They met unexpectedly.)
tamvbianc: noun 1. (weaving blade) 2. guaih tamvbianc (cow‘s neck tendon)
tamvpy: noun 1. (house): tamvpy peic (house mother); tamvpy pouc (house father). 2. (family): Kamei tamvpy duanc the. (He has family.); akai tamvpy (my family)
tamvra e: adjective; noun tamvramei (disunite): Kakai tamvpy tamvra e. (Their family is disunited.)
tamzanh: verb; noun tamzanhmei (manage): Kamei tamzanh chuyna tamzanh e. (He manage well.)
tan e: adverb; noun tanmei (always; all the time): Ai dinhkai ku tan e.(I go to school always.)
tanac e: adjective; noun tanacmei (dirty): Nang baanc tanac e. (Your hand is dirty.)
tanc e: adjective; noun tanhmei 1. (strong): Kamei tanc e. (He is strong.) 2. (hard): Ntauh tanc e. (Stone is hard.) adverb (frequently): Kamei guang tanc e. (He often came.)
tangc e: verb; noun tanghmei 1. (reached): Ai kai tangc the. (I reached home.) 2. (accomplish): Ai tamhmei guang tangc the. (I have accomplished my goal.)
tangclou e: verb; noun tangcloumei (reached): Japanmei ricmei nunc hei khou guang tangclou e. (Japanese armies reached here.)
tangeih e: verb; noun tangeihmei 1. (close one eye): Kamik tangeih e. (He closes one eye.) 2. (squint): Kamei
tangeihna: neihmik zauc e. (She squints at the sun.)
tangkan e: adjective; noun tangkanmei (raise up): kaley tangkan e (the buttock raise up)
tangkeih e: verb; noun tangkeihmei (disgusting feeling): Kamei zanh nah ta tangkeih e. (He has disgusting feeling for raw meat.)
tangkev e: adjective; noun tangkevmei (slant): khau mpav tangkev e (carry bag slant)
tangkhiangh e: adjective; noun tangkhianghmei (active): Kamei tangkhiangh e. (He is active.)
tangkhuang e: verb; noun tangkhuangmei (lift): Kaphay tangkhuang e. (He lifts his heel.); phey tangkhuang e. (lift up threads in weaving.)
tangkhungh e: adjective; noun tangkhunghmei (kneel): Kamei tangkhunghkey e. (He kneels down.)
tangkhyn e: verb; noun tangkhynmei 1. (move down): tangkhyn key e (move down) 2. lungh tangkhyn e (dis¬courage; disheartened)
tanglum e: verb; noun tanglummei (murmur): Kamei tanglum e. (She murmurs.)
tangnam: noun (loin belt of loin loom; weaving belt)
tangnamv e: verb; noun tangnamvmei (wear a piece of cloth over dress): pheyzai tangnamv e (wear a piece of cloth over sarong)
tangnang e: adverb; noun tangnangmei (abrupt; sudden): Tangnang langvna ai nangc lak e. (I don‘t have time as it is too abrupt.)
tangnuangh e: adverb; noun tangnuanghmei 1. (abrupt): Kamei tang-nuanghna tat kan e. (He went abruptly.) 2. (sudden): Tangnuangh langvna ai nangc lak e. (I don‘t have time as it is too sudden.) 3. (hast): Tangnuanghmei taanv gay mak e (Work done in a hast is not good.)
tangnut e: adjective; noun tangnutmei (tangle in a mess; muddle): langhriang tangnut e (the thread is messy); kataanv tangnut phut e (her work is muddling)
tangsyn e: verb; noun tangsynmei (move backward): thei tangsyn e (move backward)
tanguih e: verb; noun tanguihmei 1. (close eyes): Kamik tanguih e. (He closes his eyes.) 2. (doze): Kamei tanguih bam e. (He is dozing.)
tangzan e: adjective; noun tangzanmei (disturb eyesight by quick movement of something): mik tangzan e (disturb my eyesight)
tangzi-tanglei: idiom (careless): tangzi-tangleina taanh rio (don‘t do it carelessly)
tangziw e: verb; noun tangziwmei (cover head down the back with some¬thing, usually while working): Kamei phey tangziw e. (She covers her head back with cloth.); luih kuang tangziw e (cover head and back with banana leaf)
taniapc e: adjective; noun taniapcmei (dirty): Nang phay taniapc e. (Your foot is dirty.)
tankhi: noun (girl or boy of the same clan in relation to marriage): tanthi kaw nu e (it is taboo to marry among the same clan); also say tanthi
tanluang: noun (front of the leg below knee)
tanthi: noun (male and female of the same clan in relation to marriage): tanthi kaw nuh mak e (it is taboo to marry among the same clan)
tanthih e: adjective; noun tanthihmei (stingy): Kamei tanthih e. (He is stingy.)
tap e: verb; noun tapmei 1. (break rope; string etc): riang tap e (a rope breaks) 2. (lay stones): kaipung tap e (lay retaining wall); phaykhuat tap e (lay foot steps with stone)
tara e: noun; noun taramei (spill out): dui sw tara e (spill out water)
tarai e: verb; noun taraimei (courtesy visit): kaining tarai e (visit neighbour)
tarang e: adjective; noun tarangmei 1. (separate; particular): Ntumei bamv tarangna nai e. (There is a separate place for women.) 2. (extra ordinary): Mi hei gay tarang e. (This is extra ordinarily good.)
tarat e: adjective; noun taratmei (rough): chaengphut tarat e (the floor is rough) antonym ndiau e (smooth)
tarau e: adjective; noun taraumei (stick out): kachei tarau e (its horns stick out)
tarav: noun (large mat usually used for threshing paddy)
taraw: noun (smaller paddy field for early harvest)
tari e: verb; noun tarimei (thirsty): Ai dui tari e. (I am thirsty.)
tariakc e: verb; noun tariakcmei (hunt): Kamei khouringh tariakc e. (He hunts animal.)
tariangh: noun (wheel): (yarn spinning wheel) tariangh paengbyan (wheel platform)
tarik e: adjective; noun tarikmei (stripe): Kamang tarik e. (Tiger is stripe.); phey tarik e (the cloth is stripe)
taruaih: noun (Hades; land of the dead people)
tarut e: adjective; noun tarutmei (wrinkle): Kagic tarut e. (His skin is wrinkling); also say charut verb (totter): Kamei zouh mbana tarut bam e. (He is drunk and tottering.)
tarwan: noun (a pole fixed over the grave to keep things for the dead person)
tasaan e: adjective; noun tasaanmei (very long): riangbuk tasaan e (the rope is very long)
tasah e: adverb; noun tasahmei (waste): syan sw tasah e (waste money); kaganv sw tasah e (waste time)
tasiat: noun (tragedy; grave destruction): Tasiat di the! (It is tragedy!)
tat e: verb; noun tatmei (go): Ai tat e. (I go.)
tatanh: noun (strong man): nggaanv tatanh (strong young man)
tatiu: noun ( force; strength): nang tatiu patna thui o (push with force); katatiu maek e (it has no force)
tatlou e: verb; noun tatloumei 1. (visited): Ai kakai khou tatlou e. (I visited his house.) 2. (go for): Akhang tatlou o. (You go for me.) 3. (have sex): Kamei kanow khou tatlou the. (He had sex with his wife.)
tau: noun (high ground): 1. kai tau (high ground of the village) 2. khow tau (top of cliff)
taupwang: noun (shot put): taupwang phaic e (throw shot put)
tay e: verb; noun taymei (cut with sickle): Akai lau tay the. (We have harvested.); nngeic tay e (harvest thatch)
tazei: noun (salt spring where animal come to drink)
tazu: adjective (many; much): Meic tazu guang e. (Many people came.)
tazuak: noun (small): namv tazuak (small village): namv tazuak nac (man of small village)
teic: noun (the same): sa ni teic, sa mak ni teic (it is the same if you say or not)
tey e: verb; noun teymei 1. (paint): thingpu tey e (paint wood paint); kai bih tey e (paint the floor with mud) 2. (stroke): Kamei angana kabiangc tey e. (She strokes a baby’s cheek.)
thac e: adjective; noun thahmei 1. (fatty): guak thav thac e (pork is fatty) 2. (fatty taste): guak thav thac e (port fat has fatty taste)
thaek e: verb; noun thaekmei 1. (pull): Kaniw riang thaek e. (They pull rope.) 2. (ritual): Akai lauthaek e. (We had harvest ceremony.) 3. (block): kata ding thaek e (is is intercepted)
thaemc e: verb; noun thaemhmei (scrub): Ai lai thaemc e. (I scrub pot.)
thaeng e: verb thaengv; noun thaengmei (give share): kailaek thaengv thaeng e (give family share)
thaengc e: verb; noun thaenghmei 1. (hang): khau thaengc e (hang bag) 2. (hang to death): Karana riang thaengc e. (He hanged himself.)
thaengv e: verb; noun thaengvmei (cut with dao): guaih kap thaengv e (cut cow’s hind leg)
thak: noun 1. (method; way of doing something): Mi thak hei gay e. (This method is good.); kai swmei thak (the way of building house) 2. (behaviour): Kamei kathak si e. (He has bad behaviour.)
thangc: noun 1. (whole night): Aniw taanv taanc thangc e. (We work whole night.) 2. (ever): Kamei thu saraemc thangc bam kan ni the. (He will be lying ever.) distant indicative Kamei Delhi thangc bam e. (He is in Delhi.) thangcrui case marker (from): Kamei Delhi thangcrui guang e. (He came from Delhi.)
thanhlwan e: adjective; noun thanh lwanmei (fascinated by new thing): Kamei thanh lwan e. (He is fascinated by new thing.)
thanv: verb thanv e; noun thanvmei 1. (ask): Ai kakhou lat thanv e. (I ask him a question.) 2. (negotiate): now thanv e (negotiate for marriage)
that e: verb; noun thatmei 1. (block): Kamei rui achaeng that e. (He blocks my way.) 2. (break): duichaeng that e (breaks water channel)
thau: adverb 1. (up): ding thau e (stand up) 2. (start): tat thau e (start going)
thau e: verb; noun thaumei (grow): Thing-bang thau e. (Tree grows.)
thauh: noun (oil): sam thauc (hair oil); gannaeng thauc (mustard oil); mai thauc (kerosene)
thay e: verb; noun thaymei (know): Ai kata thay e. (I know him.)
thaylou e: verb; noun thayloumei (acknowl-edge): Kata mei thaylou mak e. (No one acknow-ledge him.)
the: definitive/perfective Kamei guang the. (He has come.); Tingriu puni the. (It is going to rain.)
thei: conjunction (if): kamei guang e thei (if he comes); kamei guang puni thei (if he will come)
thei e: adverb; noun theimei (behind): Kamei tat thei e. (He goes behind.); Kamei athei khou bam e. (He is behind me.)
theic e: verb; noun theihmei (die): Kamei douclaneic tei theic the. (He died yesterday.)
theiclou e: verb; noun theicloumei 1. (die for): Kamei kakandih khang theiclou e. (He died for his nation.) 2. (lie dead): Si theiclou bam e. (There is a dog lying dead.)
theihdouc: noun (long ago; ancient time): theihdouc kai (ancient building)
theilanc e: verb; noun theilanhmei (faint): kamei theilanc e (he fainted down)
theilanhmei: noun 1. (epilepsy) 2. (epileptic): kamei theilanhmei e (he is epileptic)
thi e: verb; noun thimei (put in): haan khou thi e (put in a bamboo container)
thiak: noun 1. (way of doing some-thing): nap suanghmei thiak (the way of cooking); lat samei thiak (the way of speaking) 2. (method): dinhmei thiak (teaching method)
thiam e: adjective; noun thiammei (skilful): Kamei thiam e. (He is skilful.) verb (do craft): Kamei thyam thiam e. (He does handicraft job.)
thian e: adjective; noun thianmei (grow old): Kamei thian the. (He grows old.)
thiang e: verb; noun thiangmei (cut bit by bit): Ai thingmui thiang e. (I cut tree stump.); Ai mih thiang e. (I trim pestle end.)
thiangc e: verb; noun thianghmei (abstain from): Kamei zanh thiangc e. (He abstain from meat.)
thianh: noun (peer group): akaithianhmei (our group); Kamei athianhmei e. (He belongs to my peer group.)
thiankey e: verb; noun thiankeymei (ageing; becoming older): Kamei thiankey the. (He is ageing.)
thiat e: verb; noun thiatmei 1. (insert): kai thiat e (insert thatch in the roof) 2. (enter): huh thiat e (enter something in the tooth)
thic e: verb; noun thihmei (plenty and playful drinking): Baanruh khou zoulian thic e. (People enjoy playful drink in Baanruh function.)
thik: noun (breast flesh of bird): nruay thik (chicken breast)
thimmei: (cut down some-thing cluster): mpeih piw thim e (cut down bamboo cluster)
thimc e: verb; noun thimhmei 1. (rumble): ting thimc e (thunder rumbles) 2. (pack): kainung meic thimc padik e (the room is packed with people) 3. (push in): phey khau khou thimc e (push in cloth in the bag)
thingc e: verb; noun thinghmei (block): Malay zayna chaeng thingc e. (The road blocked with landslide.)
thingchagu: noun (teak) thingchy noun (tree branch) thing-dui idiom (firewood) thinggi noun (tree bark) thingluang noun (tree trunk) thingmaan noun (tree root) thingmui noun (tree stump)
thingriam e: verb; noun thingriammei (collect firewood): Ai thingriam e. (I collect firewood.)
thingsay: noun (tree shoot) thingthai noun (tree fruit) thingzik noun (tree bud)
thip e: adjective; noun thipmei 1. (dry): zeih thip e (the pond reduce water) 2. (recede): puamhmei thip e (recedes the swell)
thiu: noun 1. (force): kathiu tanc e (it has strong force) 2. (puff; breath): kathiu la pat e (he puffs/breaths out)
thiusaengc: noun (long breath): Kamei thiusaengc zay e. (He sighs.)
thou e: verb; noun thoumei 1. (set fire):kai mai thou e (set a house on fire) 2. (demand): Kamei kapow thou e. (He demands to pay back his loan.) 3. (drive): Kamei gacri thou e. (He drives a car.)
thouc e: verb; noun thouhmei (ask someone to do something): kamei lat thouc e (He asks some¬one to do something)
thouh: noun (duty): thouh tat e (do duty); namv thouc tat e (go on duty of the village); nang thouc taanc o (do your duty)
thow: interrogative pronoun (who): Kamei thow cho? (Who is he?)
thow khang: (for whom): Mi hei thow khang cho? (For whom is this?)
thow khou: (to whom): Thow khou tiilou kanna cho? (To whom did you give?)
thow khou rui: (from whom): Nang thow khou rui mi lam tei chuna cho? (From whom you heard about it.)
thow rui: (who): Thow rui laa tat kanna cho? (Who took away.)
thow ta: (whom): Nang thow ta phu bam cho? (Whom are you looking for.)
thow tuang: (whose): Mi hei thow tuang cho? (Whose is this?)
thowkumhmei: pronoun (someone): thowkumhmei guang e thei (if someone come); thowkumhmei thay e thei (if someone knows)
thowpwni: pronoun (whoever): thowpwni guang guangmei (whoever come); thowpwni thay thaymei (whoever knows)
thuai e: adjective; noun thuaimei (exceptional; particular): Mi hei rui gay thuai e. (This is excep-tionally good.)
thuaic e: verb; noun thuaihmei 1. (bore): mu thuaic e (bore a gourd) 2. (bore): Abaw kakiw thuaic e. (Green bird bores its hole.)
thuak: noun (long depression): duibwng thuak (drainage); ting thuak (back groove; spine groove)
thuak e: verb; noun thuakmei (redeem; ransom): bangh thuak e (redeem slave)
thuan e: adverb; noun thuanmei 1. (early mor-ning): taanv taanc thuan e (work early morning); nap tu thuan e (eat early morning) 2. (kill): Meic mwang rui meic pumc sw thuan e. (Our word can kill us.)
thuanhmei: (praise): Ravguangc ta thuanc e (praise God); Kaniw khat khat ta thuanc e. (They praise one another.)
thuancku e: verb; noun thuanckumei (thanks): Nang ta thuancku e. (Thank you)
thuang e: verb; noun thuangmei (overflow): zeih thuang e (the lake overflows)
thuangc e: verb; noun thuanghmei (strike with club, usually side way): nrih tuan rui thuangc e (strike with axe handle)
thuay: noun (interest): syan thuay (money interest); nap thuay (paddy interest)
thui e: verb; noun thuimei (push with hand): Kamei ata thui e. (He pushes me.)
thuic e: verb; noun thuihmei (go along the river in search of some-thing): Kamei duithuak thuic tat kan e. (He went to river for hunting.)
thukh: noun 1. (depth): khunh thukh (depth of hole) 2. (value): taanv thukh (value of work)
thum e: verb; noun thummei (flooded; inun-dated): Ntay kaidai dui thum e. (Imphal city is flooded.) adjective zeih meic hyang thum e (the lake is deeper than our height)
thumc e: verb; noun thumhmei (eat up, usually by rat/moth): Apuakc nap bang thumc e. (Rat eats up rice plant.); Nthumc phey thumc e. (Moth eats up cloth.)
thunc e: verb; noun thunhmei 1. (cramp in): kai khou mei thunc e (people cramp in a house) 2. (push into): khau khou thunc e (push into a bag)
thut e: verb; noun thutmei 1. (wipe): mikdui thut e (wipe tear) 2. (rub): thut maan e (rub out; wipe out)
thuy e: adjective; noun thuymei (produce plenty): Aseihkwm nap thuy e. (There is plenty of harvest this year.)
thw: noun 1. tamai thu (bullet) 2. ntauh thu (pebble) 3. nap thu (grain; crumb) 4. ting thw (rain drop) 5. mik thw (eye ball)
thwan: noun 1. (award): nap thwan (paddy award); khangh thwan (mister award); tuna thwan (miss award) 2. (affect): taanv thwan (affect of hard labour)
thwan e: verb; noun thwanmei (build up): kaipung thwan e (build up retaining wall); niang thwan e (fill up with soil)
thwm e: verb; noun thwmmei (eat up): Apuakc napbang thwm e. (Rat eats up rice plant)
thyam: noun (handicraft): Kamei thyam thay e. (He is skilful in handicraft); kathyam gay e (he is skilful)
thyan: noun (villagers’ resting place on the way or in the village)
ti e: verb noun timei 1. (brightly shine): neihmik ti e (the sun brightly shines) 2. (strain): Neih riw rui amik ti e. (Sun ray strains my eyes.)
tiak e: verb; noun tiakmei (rebuke; scold): kapammei ta tiak e (scold her friend)
tianmei: (rub or wipe out): thing kiak rui bih tian ganc e (wipe out mud with stick)
tianc e: adjective; noun tianhmei 1. (soft): nap tianc e (the rice is soft) 2. (fatty taste feeling): meic lungc tianc e (I feel nausea of fatty taste)
tiangchang e: adjective; noun tiangchangmei (not fully cook): nap tiangchang e (the rice is not fully cooked)
tiap e: verb; noun tiapmei 1. (hold): tiangkap rui tiap e (hold with tongs) 2. (cut): sam tiap e (cut hair) 3. (press): kakak tiap e (press between)
tiat e: adjective; noun tiatmei (blind): Kamik tiat e. (He is blind.)
tic e: verb; noun tuihmei (glide): Nrui tic e. (Snake glides.)
tii e: verb; noun tiimei (give): Kamei rui akhang tii e. (He gives me.)
tik: noun (power): Pei khou katik maek e. (He has power in the village authority.); Nang atik thay puni. (You will know my power.)
tik-hym: noun (power and glory): tik-hym daihmei guangc (powerful and glorious king)
tiki: conjunction (but): Mi hei gay e tiki nthuih mak e. (This is good but not perfect.)
timc e: adjective; noun timhmei (wet): phey timc e (the cloth is wet) adverb (beware; word of warning): Si rui nkay timc e. (Beware of the dog.)
tin: noun 1. (nai; claw): baanh tin (nail); nruay tin (claw) 2. (edge): phey tin (edge of cloth); khow tin (edge of cliff)
tinc e: verb; noun tinhmei (bind): Kamei pytin tinc e. (She binds head gear.); khau mun tinc e (bind bag‘s mouth); nngeic tinc e (bind roofing thatch)
tingc e: adjective; noun tinghmei (bulge out): Kabung tingc e. (His stomach bulges out.)
tinggaanc e: verb; noun tinggaanhmei (day breaks): tinggaanc the (day breaks now)
tinggay e: adjective; noun tinggay-mei (sunny): Aseic tinggay e. (Today is sunny.)
tinggiu e: adjective; noun tinggiumei 1. (scare): Kamei bow pw khang tinggiu e. (He is scared of falling.) 2. (concern): Simei pat pw khang ai tinggiu e. (I am concerned for bad consequence.)
tingkaengc e: verb; noun tingkaenghmei (rain less): Aseihkwm tingkaengc e. (It rained less this year.) antonym tingtunc e
tingmik: noun (day): tingmik kathanc (new day); tingmik kathuic (every day)
tingmow e: adjective; noun tingmowmei (it is cloudy): aseic tingmow e. (It is cloudy today.)
ting-neih: idiom (weather): ting-neih si khou kapaengc pat rio (don‘t go out in bad weather)
tingriu e: compound verb; noun tingriumei (it rains): tingriu bam e (it is raining)
tingsaengc e: adjective; noun tingsaenghmei (long time): Kamei tat kanmei tingsaengc the. (He went long time back.)
tingsaengzaeng: noun (forever): Mi hei tingsaengzaeng nai bam kan ni the. (This will remain forever.)
tingsi e: adjective; noun tingsimei (rainy): Aseic tingsi e. (It is rainy today.)
tingsiamc e: verb; noun tingsiamhmei (suspicious of the spouse for having affair): Kamei kagaanv ta tingsiamc e. (She is suspicious of her husband)
tingsik e: adjective; noun tingsikmei 1. (cold): Aseic tingsik e. (It is cold today.) 2. (feel cold): Ai tingsik e. (I feel cold.)
tingthimc e: verb; tingthimhmei (thunder rumbles): Dihba thangc tingthimc e. (Thunder rumbles in the west.)
tingtunc e: compound verb; noun tingtunhmei (rain more): Aseihkwm tingtunc e. (It rained more this year.); antonym tingkaengc e
